benchmark_details.name: AblationBench
benchmark_details.overview: AblationBench is a benchmark suite for evaluating agents on ablation planning tasks in empirical AI research. It includes two tasks: AuthorAblation, which assists authors in proposing ablation experiments, and ReviewerAblation, which helps reviewers find missing ablations in a paper.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a comprehensive evaluation resource for developing ablation agents in empirical AI research.

data.source: Original research papers and ICLR submissions containing ablation studies.
data.annotation: Manual annotation of ablation examples and missing ablation suggestions.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on the matches between generated ablations and ground truth ablations.
methodology.interpretation: Higher precision indicates a better match of proposed ablations to actual ablations, while higher recall indicates comprehensive identification of relevant ablations.
methodology.baseline_results: The best LM planners identify at most 34% of ablations in AuthorAblation and 26% in ReviewerAblation.
methodology.validation: Performance assessed against a dedicated evaluation dataset with human annotations.
